trans-unit.source: Create a SQL Server Virtual Machine in Azure (PowerShell)
trans-unit.target: Create a SQL Server Virtual Machine in Azure (PowerShell)

trans-unit.source: Provides steps and PowerShell scripts for creating an Azure VM with SQL Server virtual machine gallery images.
trans-unit.target: Provides steps and PowerShell scripts for creating an Azure VM with SQL Server virtual machine gallery images.

trans-unit.source: Create a SQL Server Virtual Machine in Azure (PowerShell)
trans-unit.target: Create a SQL Server Virtual Machine in Azure (PowerShell)

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.SELECTOR]
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.SELECTOR]

trans-unit.source: Portal
trans-unit.target: Portal

trans-unit.source: PowerShell
trans-unit.target: PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This article provides steps for how to create a SQL Server virtual machine in Azure by using the PowerShell cmdlets.
trans-unit.target: This article provides steps for how to create a SQL Server virtual machine in Azure by using the PowerShell cmdlets.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] This article is for a virtual machine created in Service Management, and it is a SQL Server specific expansion on the more general steps found in the topic [Use Azure PowerShell to create and preconfigure Windows-based Virtual Machines](virtual-machines-ps-create-preconfigure-windows-vms.md).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] This article is for a virtual machine created in Service Management, and it is a SQL Server specific expansion on the more general steps found in the topic [Use Azure PowerShell to create and preconfigure Windows-based Virtual Machines](virtual-machines-ps-create-preconfigure-windows-vms.md).

trans-unit.source: Instead of Service Management, if you want to create a SQL Server virtual machine with Resource Manager in PowerShell, see the generic instructions for resource manager VMs in the following topic: [Create and preconfigure a Windows Virtual Machine with Resource Manager and Azure PowerShell](virtual-machines-ps-create-preconfigure-windows-resource-manager-vms.md).
trans-unit.target: Instead of Service Management, if you want to create a SQL Server virtual machine with Resource Manager in PowerShell, see the generic instructions for resource manager VMs in the following topic: [Create and preconfigure a Windows Virtual Machine with Resource Manager and Azure PowerShell](virtual-machines-ps-create-preconfigure-windows-resource-manager-vms.md).

trans-unit.source: Install and Configure PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Install and Configure PowerShell

trans-unit.source: If you do not have an Azure account, visit [Azure free trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/pricing/free-trial/).
trans-unit.target: If you do not have an Azure account, visit [Azure free trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/pricing/free-trial/).

trans-unit.source: [Install the latest Azure PowerShell cmdlets](../powershell-install-configure.md/#how-to-install-azure-powershell).
trans-unit.target: [Install the latest Azure PowerShell cmdlets](../powershell-install-configure.md/#how-to-install-azure-powershell).

trans-unit.source: [Connect PowerShell with your Azure subscription](../powershell-install-configure.md/#how-to-connect-to-your-subscription).
trans-unit.target: [Connect PowerShell with your Azure subscription](../powershell-install-configure.md/#how-to-connect-to-your-subscription).

trans-unit.source: Determine your target Azure region
trans-unit.target: Determine your target Azure region

trans-unit.source: Your SQL Server Virtual Machine will be hosted in a cloud service that resides a specific Azure region.
trans-unit.target: Your SQL Server Virtual Machine will be hosted in a cloud service that resides a specific Azure region.

trans-unit.source: The following steps help you to determine your region, storage account, and cloud service that will be used for the rest of the tutorial.
trans-unit.target: The following steps help you to determine your region, storage account, and cloud service that will be used for the rest of the tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Determine the data center that you want to use to host your SQL Server VM.
trans-unit.target: Determine the data center that you want to use to host your SQL Server VM.

trans-unit.source: The following PowerShell commands will display the available regions in detail with a summary list at the end.
trans-unit.target: The following PowerShell commands will display the available regions in detail with a summary list at the end.

trans-unit.source: Once you've identified your preferred location, set a variable named **$dcLocation** to that region.
trans-unit.target: Once you've identified your preferred location, set a variable named **$dcLocation** to that region.

trans-unit.source: Set your subscription and storage account
trans-unit.target: Set your subscription and storage account

trans-unit.source: Determine the Azure subscription you will use for the new virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Determine the Azure subscription you will use for the new virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Assign your target Azure subscription to the **$subscr** variable.
trans-unit.target: Assign your target Azure subscription to the **$subscr** variable.

trans-unit.source: Then set this as your current Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: Then set this as your current Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: Then check for existing storage accounts.
trans-unit.target: Then check for existing storage accounts.

trans-unit.source: The following script displays all storage accounts that exist in your chosen region:
trans-unit.target: The following script displays all storage accounts that exist in your chosen region:

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you require a new storage account, first create an all-lower-case storage account name with the New-AzureStorageAccount command as in the following example: **New-AzureStorageAccount -StorageAccountName "<storage account name>" -Location $dcLocation**
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you require a new storage account, first create an all-lower-case storage account name with the New-AzureStorageAccount command as in the following example: **New-AzureStorageAccount -StorageAccountName "<storage account name>" -Location $dcLocation**

trans-unit.source: Assign the target storage account name to the **$staccount**.
trans-unit.target: Assign the target storage account name to the **$staccount**.

trans-unit.source: Then use **Set-AzureSubscription** to set the subscription and current storage account.
trans-unit.target: Then use **Set-AzureSubscription** to set the subscription and current storage account.

trans-unit.source: Select a SQL Server virtual machine image
trans-unit.target: Select a SQL Server virtual machine image

trans-unit.source: Find out the list of available SQL Server virtual machines images from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: Find out the list of available SQL Server virtual machines images from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: These images all have an **ImageFamily** property that starts with "SQL".
trans-unit.target: These images all have an **ImageFamily** property that starts with "SQL".

trans-unit.source: The following query displays the image family available to you that have SQL Server preinstalled.
trans-unit.target: The following query displays the image family available to you that have SQL Server preinstalled.

trans-unit.source: When you find the virtual machine image family, there could be multiple published images in this family.
trans-unit.target: When you find the virtual machine image family, there could be multiple published images in this family.

trans-unit.source: Use the following script to find the latest published virtual machine image name for your selected image family (such as **SQL Server 2014 SP1 Enterprise on Windows Server 2012 R2**):
trans-unit.target: Use the following script to find the latest published virtual machine image name for your selected image family (such as **SQL Server 2014 SP1 Enterprise on Windows Server 2012 R2**):

trans-unit.source: Create the virtual machine
trans-unit.target: Create the virtual machine

trans-unit.source: Finally, create the virtual machine with PowerShell:
trans-unit.target: Finally, create the virtual machine with PowerShell:

trans-unit.source: Create a cloud service to host the new VM.
trans-unit.target: Create a cloud service to host the new VM.

trans-unit.source: Note that it is also possible to use an existing cloud service instead.
trans-unit.target: Note that it is also possible to use an existing cloud service instead.

trans-unit.source: Create a new variable **$svcname** with the short name of the cloud service.
trans-unit.target: Create a new variable **$svcname** with the short name of the cloud service.

trans-unit.source: Specify the virtual machine name and a size.
trans-unit.target: Specify the virtual machine name and a size.

trans-unit.source: For more information about virtual machine sizes, see [Virtual Machine Sizes for Azure](virtual-machines-size-specs.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about virtual machine sizes, see [Virtual Machine Sizes for Azure](virtual-machines-size-specs.md).

trans-unit.source: Specify the local administrator account and password.
trans-unit.target: Specify the local administrator account and password.

trans-unit.source: Run the following script to create the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Run the following script to create the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] For additional explanation and configuration options, see the **Build your command set** section in [Use Azure PowerShell to create and preconfigure Windows-based Virtual Machines](virtual-machines-ps-create-preconfigure-windows-vms.md).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] For additional explanation and configuration options, see the **Build your command set** section in [Use Azure PowerShell to create and preconfigure Windows-based Virtual Machines](virtual-machines-ps-create-preconfigure-windows-vms.md).

trans-unit.source: Example PowerShell script
trans-unit.target: Example PowerShell script

trans-unit.source: The following script provides and example of a complete script that creates a **SQL Server 2014 SP1 Enterprise on Windows Server 2012 R2** virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: The following script provides and example of a complete script that creates a **SQL Server 2014 SP1 Enterprise on Windows Server 2012 R2** virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: If you use this script, you must customize the initial variables based on the previous steps in this topic.
trans-unit.target: If you use this script, you must customize the initial variables based on the previous steps in this topic.

trans-unit.source: Connect with remote desktop
trans-unit.target: Connect with remote desktop

trans-unit.source: Create the .RDP files in the current user's document folder to launch these virtual machines to complete setup:
trans-unit.target: Create the .RDP files in the current user's document folder to launch these virtual machines to complete setup:

trans-unit.source: In the documents directory, launch the RDP file.
trans-unit.target: In the documents directory, launch the RDP file.

trans-unit.source: Connect with the administrator user name and password provided earlier (for example, if your user name was VMAdmin, specify "\VMAdmin" as the user and provide the password).
trans-unit.target: Connect with the administrator user name and password provided earlier (for example, if your user name was VMAdmin, specify "\VMAdmin" as the user and provide the password).

trans-unit.source: Complete the configuration of the SQL Server Machine for remote access
trans-unit.target: Complete the configuration of the SQL Server Machine for remote access

trans-unit.source: After logging onto the machine with remote desktop, configure SQL Server based on the instructions in [Steps for configuring SQL Server connectivity in an Azure VM](virtual-machines-sql-server-connectivity.md#steps-for-configuring-sql-server-connectivity-in-an-azure-vm).
trans-unit.target: After logging onto the machine with remote desktop, configure SQL Server based on the instructions in [Steps for configuring SQL Server connectivity in an Azure VM](virtual-machines-sql-server-connectivity.md#steps-for-configuring-sql-server-connectivity-in-an-azure-vm).

trans-unit.source: Next Steps
trans-unit.target: Next Steps

trans-unit.source: You can find additional instructions for provisioning virtual machines with PowerShell in the [virtual machines documentation](virtual-machines-ps-create-preconfigure-windows-vms.md).
trans-unit.target: You can find additional instructions for provisioning virtual machines with PowerShell in the [virtual machines documentation](virtual-machines-ps-create-preconfigure-windows-vms.md).

trans-unit.source: For additional scripts related to SQL Server and Premium Storage, see [Use Azure Premium Storage with SQL Server on Virtual Machines](virtual-machines-sql-server-use-premium-storage.md).
trans-unit.target: For additional scripts related to SQL Server and Premium Storage, see [Use Azure Premium Storage with SQL Server on Virtual Machines](virtual-machines-sql-server-use-premium-storage.md).

trans-unit.source: In many cases, the next step is to migrate your databases to this new SQL Server VM.
trans-unit.target: In many cases, the next step is to migrate your databases to this new SQL Server VM.

trans-unit.source: For database migration guidance, see [Migrating a Database to SQL Server on an Azure VM](virtual-machines-migrate-onpremises-database.md).
trans-unit.target: For database migration guidance, see [Migrating a Database to SQL Server on an Azure VM](virtual-machines-migrate-onpremises-database.md).

trans-unit.source: If you're also interested in seeing how to perform these steps from the Azure Management Portal, see [Provisioning a SQL Server Virtual Machine on Azure](virtual-machines-provision-sql-server.md).
trans-unit.target: If you're also interested in seeing how to perform these steps from the Azure Management Portal, see [Provisioning a SQL Server Virtual Machine on Azure](virtual-machines-provision-sql-server.md).

trans-unit.source: In addition to these resources, we recommend that you review [other topics related to running SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines](virtual-machines-sql-server-infrastructure-services.md).
trans-unit.target: In addition to these resources, we recommend that you review [other topics related to running SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines](virtual-machines-sql-server-infrastructure-services.md).
